intro: Xanthophyllum brigittae, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
